meanings.definition: The process by which red blood cells are produced in the bone marrow.
meanings.sent1: Erythropoiesis is essential for our body to have enough red blood cells.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study erythropoiesis to understand how our blood is formed.
meanings.sent3: During the biology class, the students found the topic of erythropoiesis quite fascinating.
meanings.sent4: In the factory of our body, erythropoiesis works tirelessly to create red blood cells.
meanings.sent5: The ballet of erythropoiesis in the bone marrow is a graceful dance of cell production.
